description: From French affiliation, from Latin affiliatiō, noun of action from verb affiliō, from af- (form of ad- (“to”) before an f) + filiō (from filius (“son”)).

entries.meaning: The relationship resulting from affiliating one thing with another.
(law) The establishment of a child's paternity or maternity
examples: […]  he did not  […]  forget to write to Mark a stinging letter in which he stated that if he refused to accept his responsibilities he would see that an action for affiliation was brought against him.

entries.meaning: A club, society or umbrella organisation so formed, especially a trade union.
